title: Sequoia & Kings Canyon National Parks: Rough Fire Interactive Map
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Fire in the Parks     Fire Mapping     Rough Fire Interactive Map                Rough Fire Interactive Map       Starting on July 31, 2015 from a lighting strike, the Rough Fire grew to be over 151,000 acres to be the 2nd largest wildfire in modern Sierra Nevada history. The fire was finally contained 99 days later on November 6 and was declared out in the month that followed. At one point, there were over 3,700 fire personnel assigned and the fire grew over 10,000 acres per day.  Along with support from staff and volunteers, Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks created an interactive map to share the story of the Rough Fire.  The interactive map is a way that the public can learn and share the story of the Rough Fire. As users click through the days, they can see pictures from the fire and see a map showing how the fire grew over the course of 99 days.   View full screen.
